question.questionA: Corolla with five converging scales or hairs in the throat, often closing it.
question.questionB: Corolla without  throat-scales, or  scales or hairs rudimentary, non-convergent.

question.questionA: Corolla tubular, tube very short with large spreading lobes; stamens connivent into a cone, each with a horn-like projection.

question.questionB: Nutlets large, covered with short spines.

question.questionA: Leaves  and  stems green, softly hairy; inflorescence without bracts; flowers pale blue.
question.questionB: Leaves and stems white, wooly tomentose; inflorescence with leafy bracts; flowers red, turning violet or blue.

question.questionA: Flowers without bracts; corolla small with spreading lobes.
Leaves broadly ovate; flowers in forked, one-sided spikes.
question.questionB: Leaves lanceolate; flowers in compact axillary clusters.

question.questionA: Corolla  tubular  or  campanulate,  scarcely  enlarged above; flowers zygomorphic; tube curved, lobes unequal.
question.questionB: Corolla conical, abruptly enlarged above into barrel-shaped section ending in a constricted throat and spreading lobes.

question.questionA: Stamens included in the corolla; flowers usually less than 12 mm long.
question.questionB: Stamens protruding from the corolla; flowers usually more than 12 mm long.

question.questionA: Flowers violet; corolla 8-9 mm, often longer than calyx; calyx with spreading hairs, not enlarging in fruit.
question.questionB: Flowers blue with white throats; corolla 10-12 mm, hairy, little longer than calyx; calyx with adpressed hairs, enlarging to 1 cm in fruit.

question.questionA: Bracts  more  or  less  equalling  internodes;  corolla  deep  violet;  all stamens included in the corolla tube.
question.questionB: Bracts much shorter than internodes; corolla pale violet; two stamens usually exserted.

question.questionA: Flowers 25-30 mm long; deep blue, reddish or purple.
question.questionB: Flowers less than 20 mm long; pink, lilac or white.

question.questionA: Flowers 13-18 mm, deep pink; stamens long exserted, filaments red.
question.questionB: Flowers 10-15 mm; pale blue, pink or white.; stamens long exserted; filaments pale.

question.questionA: Calyx divided to about one third; corolla tube with five hooked scales.
question.questionB: Calyx divided almost to the base.

question.questionA: Corolla yellow, with glandular hairs inside and out.
Corolla  yellow,  tube  with five transverse swellings near the base, alternating with the stamens.
question.questionB: Corolla tube naked or with five vertical lines of hairs near the base.

question.questionA: Corolla yellowish white, five longitudinal folds inside; nut white.
question.questionB: Corolla white, five longitudinal bands of hairs inside; nut brown.
